title: [rest-client-reactive] RestClientListener is not called
body:
### Describe the bug

When using the reactive-rest-client, RestClientListeners are not found. 
See the reproducer project https://github.com/pravussum/quarkus-restclientlistener-repro

When executing the test `ReactiveGreetingResourceTest` the registered RestClientListener `MyRestClientListener` should actually print something to the console, but it doesn't. 

With a breakpoint in `io.quarkus.rest.client.reactive.runtime.RestClientListeners` one can see that the call to `ServiceLoader.load()` does not return any listeners.
Removing the second argument from the call (the class loader), so that ServiceLoader is using `Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader()` instead, returns the registered RestClientListener correctly. 


### Expected behavior

RestClientListeners are found and called (See description for details). 

### Actual behavior

RestClientListeners are not found (see description for details).

### How to Reproduce?

https://github.com/pravussum/quarkus-restclientlistener-repro

When executing the test `ReactiveGreetingResourceTest` the registered RestClientListener `MyRestClientListener` should actually print something to the console, but it doesn't. 

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`
